se.ltu.android.demo.scene.state
Class Light

java.lang.Object
  se.ltu.android.demo.scene.state.Light

public class Light
extends java.lang.Object

A basic light source. One could easily create subclasses of this one to control the behavior of directional, point and spot lights.

Version:
$Revision: 24 $

copy

public Light copy()

a copy of this light

enable

public void enable(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl)
Set the glLight attributes for this light source and enables the light. Should be called inside the scene traversal.

disable

public void disable(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl)
Disables the glLight for this light source. Should be called inside the scene traversal.

Parameters:
gl -

setPosition

public void setPosition(float x,
                        float y,
                        float z,
                        float w)
Set the position.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate
y - y coordinate
z - z coordinate
w - set to 0 for a directional light or set to 1 for a point light

setPosition

public void setPosition(float[] vector4f)
Set the position. The last element in the vector defines wheter the light is a directional light (0) or a point light (1).

Parameters:
vector4f - position to set

public float[] getPosition()

the position
